text:
February 3, 1958
Or. Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director
NAEB
14 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry:
Regarding your letter of January 28th.
1) 1 think it extremely important for the NAEB to be a member
and support the International Association for Mass Communi¬
cation Research, there are many reasons for this:
s) It is important for us to be recognised as the
representative of educational broadcasting in
this country.
b) Xt is important for us to support groups with
Interests which coincide with ours and out of which
can come information which is important to educational
broadcasting. If we do not join, most of the push
from this country will apparently be in the direction
of journalism-type research and this is only one small
part of what it should be.
2) Oa the Nielsen proposal, X would certainly wait for next year,
X also wonder about the advisability of going through with
this against some rather strong opposition. Most of the sta¬
tion managers, as it is, see little value for them in research.
X am afraid their opposition to research might become even
stronger if, at this time, something is done which they feel
might be destructive of their Interests or position. As X
see it, the issue is not important enough at this time to risk
alienating the station managers.
3) think the plan to cooperate with the NPAC and EIRC on the
cosgtilatlon and analysis of radio research is wise indeed.
X assume that you received Cheydleur's letter of the 29th
concerning the issuance of certificates to those who attended the
research seminar, X do not know the shape of the budget but there
seem to me to be many more Important places where this money could
be put. However, if you think it wise, I would not argue against
Cordially,
SLB:
Sam L. Becker
